title.narrative: USAID/Uganda Maternal Child Health and Nutrition (MCHN) Activity

description.narrative: (Uganda): The MCHN activity will be funded with $4,600,000 in FY 2020 funds to support integrated, multi-sectoral nutrition and maternal and child health (MCH) interventions cutting across USAID/Uganda's portfolio. The aim of this activity is to strengthen the government's performance in implementing strategies to improve MCH outcomes. MCHN will contribute to the Mission's Journey to Self-Reliance vision by strengthening MCH service delivery and improving the Government of Uganda (GoU)-led capacity for MCH governance- both within the health sector and at the multi-sector platform. .The activity will work with GoU entities including the Office of the Prime Minister and the Ministries of Health, Agriculture, and Animal Industry and Fisheries. MCHN will engage with key donors and partners to advocate for and strengthen coordination and health systems improvements to facilitate improved MCH and nutrition services in Uganda..The key outcomes expected under this support include: improved national and subnational rollout of MCH strategies; strengthened health service delivery within urban Kampala; strengthened intra-sectoral and multi-sectoral cooperation and coordination; strengthened learning and adaptive management; and lastly, good governance and leadership at national and regional levels to drive improved maternal, newborn, child health and nutrition outcomes. The activity will also strengthen the integration and scale up of immediate postpartum family planning during the postnatal period to reduce missed opportunities for unmet need for family planning..
